radiographic_examinations.procedure_name: CT scan of the head without contrast
radiographic_examinations.findings: Extensive hypodensities in the right temporal lobe, left frontal lobe with slight mass effect on the anterior falx, right frontal lobe, and right and left parietal lobes, suggestive of posterior reversible encephalopathy syndrome (PRES).

radiographic_examinations.procedure_name: MRI of the head without contrast
radiographic_examinations.findings: Patchy and confluent areas of edema involving the supratentorial sub-cortical white matter in the bifrontal lobes, right and left temporal lobes, and indications of edema in the cortex; microhemorrhages and superficial siderosis observed.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: At the 7-week follow-up, near-complete resolution of the extensive white-matter changes and microhemorrhages.

radiographic_examinations.procedure_name: Contrast-enhanced MRI of the head and cervical, thoracic, and lumbar spine
radiographic_examinations.findings: No clinically significant stenosis or cord abnormality.
